property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: An Afghan farmer weeding his field

note.text: About one-quarter of Afghanistanâ€™s land is arable, and about half of this is cultivated every year. Both subsistence farming and pastoral nomadism are common agricultural ways of life. About 20% of the rural population is nomadic and uses land for pasture. Land disputes are an ongoing source of conflict.
Common crops include wheat, cereals, cotton, and opium poppies.
